text: The press freedom campaign has scored a win after Labor’s shadow attorney-general told Sky News journalists doing their job should be exempt from prosecution under national security laws. In a major shift, Mark Dreyfus said such legislative changes would be “appropriate”. “The government ought to be bringing legislation into the parliament to do this. Clearly this government hasn’t understood the discretions that are there,” he said. The 'Your Right to Know' campaign has seen Australian media outlets unite by censoring their front pages – and radio and television alerts asking the public to question increasing restrictions on the media. Nationals MP Barnaby Joyce lashed out over the press freedom campaign, accusing the media of taking a hypocritical approach. "To get respect around the term public interest, you’ve got to act in the public interest," he said. Image: Getty
